page.title: 04St. Nicholas, Swineshead
page.content: There has been a church in Swineshead since 12th century, the present one was completed in 14th century. It contains a fine tomb recess coffin slab and font. The rood screne still bears traces of the original painted decoration. The nave windows are original and the West door is a good example of 14th century tracery work. Some of the arms and miser cords in the choir are very old, as are many of the benches in the knave. Two interesting stone carvings can be seen to the east of the chancel arch and faint traces of wall paintings, which are due to be restored. The clock in the church dates back to 1600's although modifications were made at a later date. The clock has not been operational for 30/40 years, although there are plans for a possible restoration.
